page.title: 02ORIELTON HOME FARM HUNDLETON
page.content: Orielton Home Farm extends over 192 acres,and is wholly under grass at present.The grass is used for grazing by cattle and sheep.The cows are Herefords and Charolais the sheep are black-faced and white-faced.The farm is worked by just one man,the owner,Mr. John Morris,with the help of three tractors,(one Styer and two Fords). The cattle and sheep are brought to market in Pembroke and Carmarthen. Machinery that has been used on the farm are 3 ploughs, a baler, a mower, 8 trailers, a scraper, a haybob, a buckrack, 2 loaders and a manure-drill. Buildings consists of 8 sheds - 3 large and 5 smaller. On the farm are 120 cattle,600 sheep, 50 hens and 20 cockerels.There are two sheep dogs.They are Collies.One is called Bobby and the other is Skip.
